report_title: Public School Bus Services in the US
executive_summary: The industry provides transportation for students and faculty to and from school or other locations. According to the National Center for Education Statistics (NCES), the majority of total funding for elementary and secondary schools is provided by states and local governments...

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC AND BUDGETARY CONSTRAINTS LED TO A DROP IN REVENUE
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: School closures and remote classes due to the COVID-19 pandemic led to a decrease in the number of students who needed transportation...

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: LARGE COMPANIES ARE BETTER EQUIPPED IN COUNTERING THE EFFECTS OF OIL PRICE VOLATILITY
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Increases in fuel costs have led to higher operating costs for school bus companies...
The industry began recovering in 2021 due to widespread immunizations and the reopening of schools...

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: INFRASTRUCTURE ACT FUELS CAPITAL INVESTMENTS IN PUBLIC SCHOOL BUS SERVICES
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act signifies a $1.2 trillion commitment to infrastructure enhancements...

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Improving Macroeconomic Conditions Will Boost Revenue
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: States provide almost half of total elementary and secondary school funding and receive most of their funding from a combination of income and sales tax revenue...

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: FUEL PRICES WILL RECEDE BUT WILL STILL REMAIN HIGH
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Though fluctuating oil prices will affect profit growth, major industry companies will mitigate the effect by locking in fixed-price contracts with their providers...
Despite favorable performance overall, the number of K-12 students will slightly drop over the next five years...

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Public School Bus Services will benefit from increased government investment in infrastructure programs
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act allocates $1.2 trillion to modernizing US infrastructure, including $550.0 billion above the baseline investment...

industry_definition: This industry includes companies that primarily provide bus services to students in grades K-12 and school employees...

opportunities: Government funding for primary and secondary education

key_trends: The industry is highly fragmented with a small number of large companies dominating the market...
Companies with a good reputation have a competitive advantage...
The challenges posed by the COVID-19 pandemic have been hard to overcome...
The continued improvement in macroeconomic conditions will boost revenue...

market_segmentation.segment_description: Public elementary, middle and high schools account for over half of the industry's revenue...
According to National Center for Education Statistics data, a tenth of the nation's students are enrolled in private K-12 schools...
The Industry Also Provides Charter Busing Services To Various Other Groups...

products_and_services.product_description: A typical district consists of several schools...
The second-largest portion of industry revenue stems from contracts with private schools...
Bus companies provide employees with fixed-route transportation...

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Government Funding for Primary and Secondary Education
demand_determinants.determinant_description: When government funding for primary and secondary education declines, school districts outsource school bus services...

business_locations.location_description: The Mid-Atlantic region of the US is home to the largest concentration of services...
The Great Lakes region has the second-largest concentration of services in the US...
The moderately high proportion of establishments in the Plains region is because of the region's willingness to outsource transportation needs...

regulations_points.regulation_title: Federal, state and municipal laws focus on passenger and driver safety regulations
regulations_points.regulation_description: At the federal level, school buses are subject to the School Bus Safety Act of 1974...

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE COMMERCIAL MOTOR VEHICLE SAFETY ACT (CMVSA)
regulations_points.regulation_description: The Commercial Motor Vehicle Safety Act is overseen by the Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration...
The Drug-Free Workplace Act of 1988 is a federal law that mandates employers to establish and maintain a drug-free environment...
Insurance policies within public school bus services in the US safeguard the school district and students from financial losses...

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry is in a mature life cycle stage.
The industry has a high level of revenue volatility.

basis_points.basis_description: Legal barriers include regulation, licensing and complex procurement processes...
Significant capital investment is required to purchase buses...

concentration_points.concentration_title: Consolidation Boosts Market Share for Larger Companies
concentration_points.concentration_description: Industry growth stems from acquisitions by larger public school bus companies...

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Fuel Accounts for the Largest Individual Portion of Total Purchase Expenses
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: According to the American School Bus Council...
This industry requires a large amount of labor and the cost of labor is a significant portion of the operating expenses.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: This industry requires a large amount of labor...

volatility_points.volatility_title: THE INDUSTRY BENEFITS FROM A STABLE SOURCE OF DEMAND
volatility_points.volatility_description: The number of children enrolled in K-12 education is subject to very few demand shocks...

volatility_points.volatility_title: Fluctuations in Fuel Prices Have Created Significant Uncertainty
volatility_points.volatility_description: Though the price of crude oil fell dramatically early during the current period...

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Technology for Enhancing the Safety and Efficiency of School Buses is Being Implemented
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Because of increased pressure from parents and a focus on cost-effectiveness...

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: ALTERNATIVE FUEL PUBLIC SCHOOL BUSES ARE BECOMING MORE POPULAR
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: To cut emissions and fuel costs...

FAQs.answer: A majority of funding for school bus services contracts comes from public schools...

FAQs.answer: Safety, price, fuel efficiency, and timeliness are key marketing focal points...
